paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Glu109Gln, including penetrance data from two affected individuals.

patients.phenotype: One with polyneuropathy and the other with cardiac involvement

individual_records.phenotype_details: Polyneuropathy with numbness and weakness in limbs.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In this patient in whom there was a suspicion of familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP), a pathologic heterozygous c.325G>C mutation in the TTR gene was detected.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac involvement with dyspnea and sensorimotor axonal polyneuropathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Her genetic analysis revealed a heterozygous p.Glu109Gln mutation.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a loss-of-function protein that forms insoluble amyloid fibrils.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as both patients are affected.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients are symptomatic but can walk without assistance, indicating Stage I TTR-FAP.
key_quotes: The same mutation may rarely cause different clinical pictures.
One of our patients had polyneuropathy as the main clinical manifestation, while the other additionally had neuropathy; nevertheless, cardiac involvement was the predominant finding.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
